title: PHPlistKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPlistKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Assign elements of an array to variables: "; echo "$b is " . $b . "
"; echo "$c is " . $c . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The list keyword keyword assigns elements of an array to a list of variables. If there are not enough elements in the array it will output a notice and assign null to the remaining variables. Note: Since PHP 7.1.0, which elements are assigned to the variables can be selected using arrow => syntax. More Examples Example Choose which element is assigned to which variable: $a, 0 => $b, 1 => $c) = [1, 2, 3]; echo "$a is " . $a . "
"; echo "$b is " . $b . "
"; echo "$c is " . $c . "
"; ?> ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPlistKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPlistKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPlistKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
